entry.title: Python Tutorial Day 0: Hello Python! Nice to Meet Yea!
entry.content:
Hello friends,

As promised here we are starting a Python tutorial series. This will go 2 week long, including 14 tutorials. Can you learn Python only in 2 weeks? No you can’t. Teaching you everything Python has to offer is not the objective of this series. I am aiming for those who are brand new to programming, and want to introduce programming to them gently. Please read the announcement for more details about the series.

I deeply apologize for the delay in publishing this post. Many funny things are going on around me nowadays. They have started development work in harkuchh, I had my own projects I was bootstrapping and my relations with harkuchh are on shaky grounds. This series might be the last I write on this blog, but I will finish it before leaving.

Let’s not waste time and start with our day 0 of learning Python. From the title you might have already guessed, there will be 15 tutorials in total. This one is meant for setting up the Python interpreter so that you can easily write and run Python programs on your own machine. We will also discus some basic terminology related to programming and there will of course be the traditional hello world. Don’t skip on reading this one considering it a filler. If you are coming from the world of languages like PHP, C family languages or Java etc, there are some new things for you to grok.

Installing Python

You need to know about versions of Python before you install Python. Python has 2 major versions: 2.x (latest 2.7.6) and 3.x (latest 3.3.4). Those new to Python often get confused which one they should use. There are obvious benefits of Python 3.x over 2.x, but I recommend you to download and install 2.x. There are too many reasons to mention here. I am using 2.7 on my machine, so I recommend you to install a 2.x version (whichever is latest on the site) just to keep up with the programs we will write in this series.

Windows

It’s very easy for MS Windows users to install Python on their machines. Since Windows is built as an idiot-proof operating system, there are click and install packages (aka setups) available. Follow these steps.

  • Go to the official python download site
  • Download the latest 2.x package for windows from the site
  • It’s a traditional windows installer which will guide you through the installation.
  • Just run the installer and go through ‘next’ clicks to install
  • That’s all you need for now

Linux

If you are using some variant of Linux, cheer up as Python is most likely already installed on your system. Most Linux systems come preinstalled with a 2.x version of Python.

But there is one extra goodie packaged with Windows installed that is that is not installed in Linux by default. It’s called IDLE. We’ll talk about it in a minute. You can easily install it with the package manager of your distro.

Running Python

You most likely now have Python installed on your system which is ready to roll. Python has something new for those who code in more traditional languages. If you are using Windows, go to the Start Menu and search of Python IDLE. Idle is a simple GUI Python IDE which is meant for aiding new Python devs to get started quickly. If you are a Linux user and have not install Idle, you can just shoot out your terminal and enter python. A python shell will be spawned for you.

What you are seeing in above snapshot is the Python Shell. Python provides a shell (also called REPL) to help making programs interactively. It’s fun to use and you will use it for making almost every Python program for some time.

You can type in any valid Python statement in there, and press Enter. Python will execute that statement, prints the output and ask you for entering more. That’s why it is called REPL (Read Eval Process Loop). The shell reads every single line you enter in there, it evaluate that line, process the task you give it, and Loops for more input.

At this moment we have not learned any Python code yet, but you can try basic calcualtions like 5+5 or anything. You can also write your name in ' or ". It will simply evaluate it, print result and ask for more.

print statement: This is the first thing generally taught to new programmers. I won’t break the tradition. print statement in Python is used to print anything on the screen. Like if you want to print your name, just write print "My name". Yes, for printing a sentence, it is required to put in inside ' or "s.

Play around with repl more if you want.

Hello world program in Python

We will close today’s tutorial with the hello world program in Python. REPL allows us to execute statements interactively, but when writing actual programs, we need to save them in files for executing later. Traditionally, python programs are written in files with extension .py. We will talk about them some other day.

Let’s quickly wrap up and write our ‘hello world’ program.

I told you Idle is actually a simple IDE (Interactive Development Environment) for Python. It allows you to create Python programs, and run them from right inside the Idle. Open a new file in Idle:
* Go to File Menu * Click New File (or whatever new option is there, sorry I am using Linux right now)

It will open a new window. Note that this windows is not an interactive shell. You can write multiple statements in it and they will not automatically execute. We will write our hello world program in it.

You might have already guessed it. Our program is just one single statement.

Write above line in the window, and save it with any name and .py extension.

.py files can be executed in Windows by simply double clicking on them. But we will execute this one from right inside the Idle. Just press F5 key. The output of our program will be shown in the Python shell (the other window).

That’s it for today.

Note: I wrote this one in a sort of rush because I didn’t want to delay it any further. There were readers coming back to harkuchh for this tutorial series and going back disappointed. If you don’t understand anything, or find something hard to understand, or something doesn’t work, or for any kind of queries, please leave a comment.

entry.title: Announcing 2 Week Python Tutorial Series
entry.content:
Few days back we shared our experience about how we utilize the Python programming language in our work at harkuchh blogging valley. We got very positive interest about it and readers requested tutorials about the Python programming language.

So here I am with the announcement of the python tutorial series on harkcuhh.com.

2 week tutorial series

I have drafted a roadmap for a tutorial of 2 weeks. We’ll publish Python tutorials here and continue for 2 weeks. There will be 14 tutorials, one for each day. You might be thinking if it is possible to master Python in 2 weeks. It is not. Mastering anything takes time. My aim here is to teach you to start thinking in Python. So that you can open any tutorial over there and make sense of it.

I suppose thing which would be rolling in your head would be something like “How much Python will I learn from this tutorial?”. There are not actual metrics to know how much of a language you know, but you will learn enough to continue on your own, or to follow more advanced tutorials that I will do after this one.

This series is meant for absolute beginners, who know little to no programming. We will emphasize more on basics and the thought process one needs to solve problems the Python way.

We will start with a very gentle introduction to the Python programming language, and will raise the bar with every tutorial. We will discuss the general programming problems which are taught in most programming classes, just to showcase how easy it is to do same things with Python. It will enable you to do comparison between other languages and Python if you follow some other course in some other programming language.

My reason for starting this series on harkuchh.com is more than teaching some folks programming. Programming is heavily under-rated in our city Chandigarh. Tech scene in the city is daunting. No enthusiastic community, no user groups, and dominance of PHP. It’s a nightmare. This should change. I want to build a community of programmers. I want to discover the hidden gems in our blogging community. There are many smart people in this community, who I think can make brilliant programmers.

Who’s the targeted audience?

As Krishan has told me, primary readers of harkuchh.com are bloggers, not much acquainted with programming. I want to usher those guys to the world of programming, without being hard on their brains. It will be a fun trip.

How much time you should give to the tutorial?

It will not be a very fast paced or heavily technical tutorial. I am aiming for teaching enough programming that you’ll be able to do some fun things yourself, and will be able to pursue deeper tutorials.

What you will and what you will not learn

You’ll not be able to do magic with just reading these 14 tutorials. At the end of Day 14, you will be able to make sense of any Python tutorial. And depending on how smart you are and with how much dedication you follow this series, you shall be able to automate several of you day-to-day tasks (computer related of course). I won’t make huge promises, but you potential is limited by you only. Work hard, love your work, and conquer the world.

Happy Hacking!

entry.title: Tricks to Search Amazing Things With Google
entry.content:
This gonna be a long post, but I bet you won’t want to miss a single word. Krishan tried to convince me to break it into 4 different posts by giving multiple references from all his blogging ‘knowledge’ (here’s a pun if you can get it), but I din’t agree. Quality of content is more important imo.

Here I am telling best of the tricks I use to get what I want from Google. They are fun. If you have some more you think I should know, please mention in comments. Enjoy!

Exclude all results of a website

So many times we need to search something but results from some spammy website clutter all search results. Search with following query to remove results from a particular website

-site:“spamy_site_name.com”

e.g

big bang theory episode -site:youtube.com

Above query will remove all results of youtube.com.

How it work

You know already if would have read my last post about Google Syntax. There are two things working here.

  • “–”
    The minus(‘–’) sign tells google to exclude results of the query directly after it.
  • site:
    This tells google the website to be excluded

Direct download anything

We all love downloading free music, right? But discovering music has become a tedious task with all those spam sites punching ads in our faces.
Here’s a trick to get to direct links of songs on a website. Search for the following query and replace desired fields to get direct links (most of the time):

intitle:“index of” mp3 wadali brothers

You can replace anything after and including ‘mp3’.
In my school days I created a bot to download porn using this technique. I had one hell of a porn collection back then. I still curse me for deleting it :–/

How it work

This trick uses the fact that people on Internet are not actually all smart. There are pretty stupid people around here.

What we are actually doing here is that we are not searching for any pages created by site developer, but for the default pages which server generates for filesystem access over Http. Don’t worry if you didn’t get it.

Try opening something like “file:///”. There is no web page over there, but your browser might be showing you a list of files. This is exactly what we are searching for, a page with direct access to the folder on server where ‘mp3’ are saved.

Beware of spam

I am not the only one who know this trick. Spammers know it very well too. This query will work without a glitch for uncommon terms (like ‘wadali brothers’) which are not very popular. But if you search for something remotely famous (or too general like hindi songs), you will find herds of spam sites rolling on your site.

Detect spam

How can you differentiate b/w spam page and real page you are looking for?
Well, as I said, we are not actually looking for any page at all. So if you see anything stylish (like colors, styles, ads, sidebars), it’s not a real page. Real thing we are looking for do not have anything but white background, black text, blue links (violet visited links), a header and an untitled list. Nothing more.

How to Avoid spam

  • Use the previous technique of excluding all results from a website
    Just keep adding -site:spamsite.com for every spam site you don’t want to see.

  • Avoid too general queries
    Try to search for something specific like the song name or singer name. It works to a limit though. If you are searching for something very popular, spam is there waiting for you.

Download books and documents

This one is my favorite. I read a lot of books. So of course I download a lot of them. This technique can actually be used to download any kind of document available in some specific file extension.

ext:pdf how to think like computer scientist python

And there you get direct links to the pdf file. You can replace ‘pdf’ with ‘doc’,‘odf’,‘epub’ or any other format. You will likely meet less spam in this dimension, but there are times when you’ll not find a book. Publicly available free books will generally be there though.

How it work

It search for files with specific file extension. Duh! How else it might be working?

View public cameras

You can search cameras which have public access. I mean you can get access to the video stream of some publicly available video cameras. Sometimes there are controls available as well for controlling cameras.

You can look through cameras placed in many places like traffic lights, shopping stores, offices and even home cameras sometime. You need to search for special queries for this. They are kinda hard to remember, so even I’ve made a list of those queries.

How it work

It’s same technique as ‘direct download anything’. We are searching for some ‘special’ pages on the net that Google has (by mistake?) crawled.

entry.title: 5 Firefox Plugins I Can't Live Without
entry.content:
I use Firefox as my primary web browser. I have emotional attachments with Mozilla and their mission. I used Chrome for sometime, but I ditched it for some reasons. Firefox make me feel more like home. The philosophical bond of trust is a big thing for me.

Here’s a list of top 5 Firefox addons I use daily. Whenever I switch to a new machine, installing these is generally the first thing I do.

FxChrome

FxChrome is a Chrome like theme for Firefox. Firefox is cool, but it doesn’t look that cool. By default I mean. This theme make Firefox look like Chrome, while keeping all Mozilla goodness.

Wappalyzer

Wappalyzer is a browser extension that identifies the technologies used on websites. Whenever I see a good site, first thing that come to mind is what technologies are these guys using?

Wappalyzer save me a lot of work. It shows the technologies used by the sites in the address bar. So whenever I visit a website, it tells me things like they are using Wordpress, jQuery, Google Analytics and other technologies.

Ghostery

Ghostery is for my paranoid self. It stop websites from tracking me. Ghostery detects and stop all sort of trackers used on websites, from analytics to social media widgets. I used to use AdBlock Plus as well earlier, but now I use Ghostery only.
After all ads are the reason why content on Internet is free. Ghostery protects my privacy while I am still able to support publishers.

Resurrect Pages

Web pages go down all the time. It happen a lot with me that I visit some website and it’s down. Resurrect pages help resurrecting the dead (pages) using various archiving sites of the web. Whenever I visit a dead page, it shows a list of archives, and I can choose to visit a snapshot of the page from there.

PushBullet

You’ll understand the value of PushBullet only if you use the PushBullet app on your Android phone. PushBullet help me share content between my phone and my browser. I send all sort of things with it to my phone, would it be the todo list of things I need to do when I go out of my home (that actually happen very rarely), or links to articles I want to read on phone when lying in bed or notes etc.

And for some reason my brain start producing awesome ideas when I am about to sleep, and there is no time to start my computer to note them. Then I just start my phone, and send those ideas to my computer as notes. It’s a really useful app.

entry.title: Why Bloggers Need to Save Themselves From Google: Lesson We Got After Losing 400K
entry.content:
Google is no more that same open company which had ‘don’t be evil’ as their slogan.
Google is evil. We all know it.

But Google can be particularly evil to you if you are a blogger. Being a blogger, most of your living depends on Google one way or other. Google is a major traffic source, all information you need come through Google, and Google Adsense is major source of most blogger’s income. Imagine Google having a grudge against you. I mean against you, as a person in particular. Everything you do is seen with a skeptical eye, and suddenly your websites which were rolling few days back are now ruins facing drought of visitors.

Yes, Google can do it, and it does.

Our Experience

We at Harkuchh – The Blogging Valley were unfortunate enough to face the fury of Google. We have multiple blogs here, some good and some not so good. And we are always doing all sort of experiments to try new things. Few months back, we were working as always and things were going as breeze. Then Krishan started a test project, a kind of illegitimate blog. It was an experiment. We spent very little time on it, and it was just lying around in some corner, with Krishan occasionally working on it.

Few weeks after starting that experiment, we started facing problems in getting traffic to our websites. For some reason, all of our websites were facing more than 50% fall in traffic. Even the best quality posts which have backlinks on high PR sites stopped appearing on Google search results. It was incomprehensible. What could we have done wrong to bring this on us? And few days later another nightmare came true. Our Google adsense account got disabled, with no clarification of course. With it went our Rs 400+K sum. All that was left was shattered plans, unbalanced budget and minds full of confusion.

The Mistake

You guessed it right. That experiment was the mistake. But it was not at all clear at that time. There was not a single link that could tell any connection between our legitimate blogs and that experiment blog. We do extra effort to not to link our blogs with each other in any way. Then how could Google tell that experiment blog belonged to us? How could it be that all our genuine blogs were suffering Google’s rage?

The real mistake was not that we somehow made some connection between the experiment and some of our real blogs. Because there was no connection. We cross-checked many times.

There was actually no mistake. Things should not have been the way they were.

The Lesson

As we noticed later, the only thing that could have resulted in connection was a Google account. What Krishan did was that he used same Google account for analytics and webmaster tools which was also used on our other blogs. But he didn’t use the adsense on the experiment.
I know Google tracking everyone on Internet is not a new story, but this was new for us. This had never happened before. Google is now making connections between different sites you own. Any one site you run can affect your other sites as well.

So our suggestion is, if you are going to try something crazy never ever use same Google accounts in any way on different sites. It would be even better if you operate on your experiments in sandboxed environments. That’s what we are doing now. And it’s working, for now at least.

So better save your ass from Google. It’s no longer our all good friend.

entry.title: Why I Am Learning Python
entry.content:
Why I’m learning Python? well yes, this is really a very valid question and it has a solid answer too, I think everybody should read this, not because I’ve written this for you but because it has much much importance and advantages for you.

Some days back, I was in my office with my friend Channi (Charanjit Singh) we were planning to work on a website for a special purpose. While talking I said him that, “on this website we’ll need to do same thing again and again hundreds of time and it will take lots of our time and effort :(“. Then he said “Don’t worry dude, I’ll make a script that will automate all this thing and then you will need to do that only once and rest will be done by the script.”

I was surprised and like, is it possible? He said “Yeah dude, it’s simple and will not take too long to be developed” then I told him to do it fast, and I started writing a post on my movie blog and when I published only one post He said “Done bro! here it is.”

I said “seriously, will it do all those things which I was talking about?” I got the best reply, it was ‘off course!’.

I said let’s see, and unbelievably it done all those things in just minutes, any person who have no knowledge of coding and programming will never believe that the things which required at least 1 week day and night work was done in just minutes. I was shocked! and said to my friend, “Awesome bro, how did you do it”, he replied “Python bro, it’s awesome”.

Till then I just knew that Python is a programming language but I didn’t know anything about its working or coding. Actually I didn’t know any coding or programming language. Not even C++ in which I spent all four years of my B.tech degree.

So when I heard Python, I didn’t take even a second to say, “bro! can’t I learn Python?”

“Of course you can”, he said. “But you will need to be regular on it”, he added.

I replied joyfully “of course I will, it will be great if I can do things in minute(s) for which I give hours, days and even weeks to complete, so let’s start it now.”

He said No! We will start it from tommorow, let me prepare modules and a structure for teaching Python in the best way to you. And next day we started.

And now, just after a week.. Even I cannot believe that now I can do many things with my own created crawlers which none of you can do even in weeks, please note, I’m not showing off here but I’m just trying to tell, how much difference simple coding are able to create.

Let me share an example with you so that you can get my words better, previously I used to copy contents of events websites manually in which I needed to..

  • Go to a website

  • Open a post

  • Create a new text file (to copy post)

  • Copy posts title from that website

  • Paste that into text file

  • Copy body of the post

  • Paste that into text file again

  • Copy keywords, description and tags from source code

  • Paste them into text file

…and these all steps were required for every post and imagine if there were 100 posts on that site it simply means I needed to do these all things 100 times to get everything in my hand, most of you are doing same, I know. But..

today, I just take some minutes to create a crawler for any specific website and run it, after that crawler do all the rest thing in minutes. Any non technical person will never believe that, it copies posts at the rate of 500-600/minute with proper distinguish between every part of the post which includes title, body, images, keywords, tags, description, category and all related information which I think I require and I told, to to do same thing manually I required at least 2-3 days.

So this is the difference and that all is possible with a simple effort to learn python. That is why I’m learning Python.

entry.title: Five Reasons Why Every Blogger Should Learn Programming
entry.content:
In this post I am writing about why every blogger (and every person in general) should learn to code. Programming as itself is an asset that will make you a better and smarter person. Most important benefit you’ll get is the ability to make literate decisions. You’ll learn how to break down that large problem you are facing, and how to solve it’s one piece at a time. Besides, it gives ou great level of confidence.
Here are five reasons to convince you to learn programming.

You want to be a God

I heard yea! So you wanna be a God? Well, you can be actually. Programmers are mini Gods who create little worlds with their programs and control everything. Literally. It’s hard to understand this feeling without really experiencing it. But the ultimate control building a software offers is addictive. I myself was a gaming addict in my school time, and now gaming addiction is turned into coding addiction.

The amount of automation you can put in your daily work truly make you feel like a God. It makes me feel real good when I see my script running and think my code can do in 30 minutes what my peers at harkuchh would have taken 4-5 days.

One blogger who know coding equals ten average bloggers

Don’t get hyper. Let me explain why. Programming skills are valuable in every field directly or remotely related to computers and internet off course.I mean your programming skills become specially important in fields which are completely dependent on computers and Internet. Blogging is such a case. I joined Harkuchh – The Blogging Valley about a month ago, and the technological improvements we’ve made here improved our productivity while brought down the expenses. Although many things are under experiment phase, the time we’ve saved so far which would have been wasted in trying things which don’t bring any profit is enormous.

To give an example, consider data gathering. We all need to collect data from various sources, many times it involve just copy pasting data from some other source. We’ve built a software to automate such things, and saved days of work.

But there are more benefits than I can describe here. Enough benefits that Krishan Kummar (founder of harkuchh.com) is learning to code. (We are thinking about starting giving programming classes to bloggers. Please comment or mail us if you are interested).

Dream, Believe, Achieve

These quotes all seem too good to be practical in real world. This might be true, but not in the world where you can even be a God. You just wish if there was a software which would do something awesome here, and you roll out your emacs (or your favorite editor), and voila! It’s there. Anything is possible, all you need to do is to believe in your wit and skills. Sounds too good to be real? Welcome to the world of programmers :)

It teaches you to make better decisions in life

I just can’t emphasize how beneficial it is for anyone (including you bloggers) to have some programming skills. Even if you don’t become a wiz, acquaintance with programming is a very much helpful. When you don’t know anything about how your websites and software are actually working under-the-hood, you are like riding a bike eye-folded. You either hit a tree or something, or you go too slow.

Most important benefit you’ll get is the ability to make literate decisions. You’ll learn how to break down that large problem you are facing, and how to solve it’s one piece at a time. Besides, it give you great level of confidence. When you think of a crazy idea, and you have good programming skills under your belt, you quickly analyze all the steps which you’ll need to take to make that awesome thing. You carry this habit to your real life. And suddenly all things become simple, because you’ll quickly analyze everything and sort out plans for doing things which seem impossible or very hard to others. It’ll give you a new perspective in your career, as well as in your life.

Programming is fun, and it makes you smarter

I ditched gaming for coding, not because it give me money, but simply because it’s more fun. I still play games once in a while when I want my brain to relax, but I’m yet to find a game which’ll give me more thrill than coding. If you follow the right steps (like choose right first language, right teacher, right things to do in your first steps in coding world), programming is like playing a very powerful computer game. Projects you do are your highscore and skills you gain are your reward, that’ll stay with you for rest of your life. Besides, remember all your kids (the next generation) will be taught coding in schools like we are taught poems, then your children will ask you questions related to coding, what you gonna do then? ;)

entry.title: Strong Passwords, Weak Passwords: How to Generate Strongest Possible Passwords Which You Can Remember
entry.content:
Passwords we know, the most common method used by almost all websites for authenticating users. But how good is this method? Well, the strength of this method partially depend on the strength of the password we choose.

What’s the strength of a password?

Strength of a password is determined by a number of things. * Character set
Most important thing which make a password strong is its character set. Character set of a password means which characters are used in the password, like lower case characters, upper case characters, numbers, symbols etc. A password which has all different type of characters is considered stronger. * Length of the password
Second most important thing about strong passwords is their length. Longer passwords are considered more secure. * Guessability of the password
Another thing which determine strength of password is of easy it is to guess a password. Easier to guess passwords are weak. A security researcher has said that any password you can remember is not safe enough.

The problem

So we have a problem here. They say any password we choose which we can remember is not safe enough. Most people choose easy, simple to remember password, which is perfectly reasonable. Why putting extra load on brain? But this laziness can cost more than you think.

The Solution


So I wanted a system which will create passwords for me which I can remember, but which can’t be guessed or cracked easily. One solution to this is passphrases. For example, instead of choosing a single word password like “facebook123”, I choose a sentence like “facebookhasbluecolor”. And even better, change some character with symbols and numbers, “f@c3b00kh4sBlu3C0lOr”. Awesome, right! But it still can be remembered. So according to our theory that any password which can be remembered is not safe enough. I want something simple to remember and type and still very strong and long. So being a software developer, I made a system which do exactly this. I call it fireword.

What is fireword?

Fireword is an application in which you enter a simple word or phrase, and it give you a very strong and impossible to guess password.

  • Fireword always generate same password for same word. So you remember your simple password, and generate a strong one with this site. And then when you need to login again, regenerate strong password with your simple one.
  • Fireword allow you to select the length of the password. You can choose from 8 to 128 character long password.
  • For example, just entering ‘facebook’ become this ‘bF2A37d5e8%{61?C]>3E[{(9{’. Any password can be expanded to at most 128 character long complex password.

    Recommended ways to use Fireword

    It’s really simple. Instead of using you easy to remember but weak password for a website, change your password with the password generated by fireword.

  • Enter your simple password in Fireword, get a strong one, and use it for logging in.
  • Do not copy-paste strong generated passwords on your hard-disk, it is very insecure. Instead, whenever you need to login again, just get back to the fireword, and generate password again. Fireword will always generate same strong password for same simple password you enter.

    How to choose passwords?

  • Instead of choosing ridiculously stupid passwords like ‘password’, you should choose little smarter passwords. Even if you are hardening your passwords with fireword, try choosing a better password.
  • Choose different passwords for different sites following some pattern, like
  • Use the name of the website for which you are generating password and use some words in front and end of it. Like For facebook choose bluefacebookaccount For google choose greengoogleaccount Come up with your own patterns. You can even use your phone number, your name and the site name in the combo. Convert the pattern with fireword, and get strongest password possible. Amazing. Isn’t it!
    NOTE: Firefox and Chrome extensions are on their way. With them you’ll not even need to visit firewordgen.herokuapp.com.

entry.title: Full Fledge Guide on TLD's - What Is Top Level Domain(s)
entry.content:
Top level domain which is also abbrebiated as TLD is the very last segment of any domain name, every domain’s last part is simply called as TLD. The TLD is the letters immediately following the final dot in an Internet address i.e. any website url, for Instance in Harkuchh.com here .com is TLD of generic class (we will talk about TLD classes below). Most generally TLD is use to identifies something about a website is associated with, like its purpose, the organization that owns it or the geographical area from where it has originates, and every type of TLD has a different registry which is being maintained by a designated organization the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) under the direction of ICANN i.e. The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers.

To better understand TLD see our Internet address which is, http://Harkuchh.com now here com is the top-level domain name and Harkuchh is the second-level domain name and if a domain has anything even before second level domain then it is called as a subdomain. When these all merge together they build a fully qualified domain name (FQDN) the addition of HTTP:// makes an FQDN a complete URL.

Four (4) major categories of TLDs

Generic top-level domains (gTLD) — These are the most used, common and familiar type of TLDs. Examples include “com” for “commercial”, “org” for “organization” and “edu” for “educational.” Most generic TLDs are open for everyone to register, but there is a subgroup that is more strictly controlled and that is not used broadly.

Country-code top-level domains (ccTLD) — Each ccTLD identifies a particular country and every ccTLD is two letters long, for example we can see the ccTLD for India is .in and for United States is .us.

Infrastructure top-level domain — This type is very often used class of TLD may be that is the reason there is only one TLD in this group, ARPA (Address and Routing Parameter Area). The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) manages this TLD for the IETF.

Sponsored top-level domains (sTLD): These are overseen by private organizations.

ICANN Proposed an expansion of the TLD system to allow anyone to register and also reserve any spare unused letter sequence as a TLD for Their exclusive use, in April 2009. For example if a company who use to sell sotwares want to to use .Soft as a TLD then they can use it. According to ICANN chief executive Paul Levins, Such an extension would lead to thousands of new TLDs in the coming years.

entry.title: How to Use Google Like a Pro: Tips to Use Google Syntax
entry.content:
I know you all use Google to reach everywhere on the Internet, but are you using it properly? Google actually provides a specific syntax for searching which is unknown to the masses. Also known as the Google operators, this syntax can make your Googling much easy and much less frustrating.

It’s specially useful for bloggers since all of us need to keep an eye on the Internet trends. It’s very useful to know how to properly use our most used tool, that is Google.

So let’s waste less time an look at what Google has to offer for us.

How to use Google syntax?

All the search operators described here can be used by putting the operator in the search box followed by the search query. Like to use related: operator, following query will be used

related:"harkuchh.com"

related: Search for related sites

related:"example.com"

related: is used to search for websites which are similar to the website we provide in search box. When we use this operator, Google will search for any information related to the given website from all over the Internet. Google will show websites which have similar content.

link: Search for all pages that link to a particular url

link:"http://harkuchh.com/trick-to-copy-content-from-a-website-with-copy-protector-enabled/"

This operator will search for all the pages that link to the given url.

site: Search within a particular website only

"site:"harkuchh.com" blogging tips

Above query will only search ‘harkuchh.com’ for the words ‘blogging tips’. This is a very useful operator. Just imagine when you need to find a particular post you once seen on a website but can’t find a link to it. It’s one of my most used operators.

Search for an exact phrase or word

When we search for a sentence on Google, it doesn’t just search for that exact sentence. Try searching for

I will become dictator of the world

Google will search for text which have ‘I’, ‘will’, ‘become’ etc anywhere on the page. But if we want to only search for pages which contain the complete sentence “I will become dictator of the world”, we can do it just by putting the whole sentence within quotes. Like this

"I will become dictator of the world"

Exclude something in the results

Sometimes we want that some specific type of results should not appear in the search results. Google provide a special operator just for this purpose.
That is ‘–’.
Yes just that. Putting a ‘–’ in front of any word will show results which do not have that word in them. To make it even better, this work with other Google operators as well.

hello lady how are you -season

Above query if searched without ‘-season’ will show some youtube results about some seasons of some TV program. But running above query will remove those results which have the word ‘season’ in them.

entry.title: Trick to Copy Content From a Website With Copy Protector Enabled
entry.content:
Copy protector is a wordpress plugin which is used by many wordpress sites to stop readers from copying the site content. When you visit a site and find it good to share some part of it, this type of plugins irritate us the most. In these cases, you either share the whole page, or you don’t share anything.

There are many such plugins which prevent users from copying partial content from a website. Here we have a solution to this problem.

The solution we are mentioning here work against all plugins which prevent copying content. This means you don’t need to know which plugin is used by the website that is stopping you from copying, following solution simply work against anything.

How do these plugins work?

Although this is not necessary to stop those copy protector plugins, but having proper knowledge is a good thing.

What we see on a web page is HTML content which is styled with CSS stylesheets. HTML and CSS do not offer much programming power to do anything like stopping people from copying content.
But there is a third power on the webpage which is actually used for programming fancy things on a web page. Its called javascript.

Javascript is a web scripting language that run in our browser, which can do many many awesome things. Preventing us from copying is one of them. So if we can somehow disable the execution of javascript in our browser, all those plugins which stop us from copying content will simply stop working.

But how do we do it?

In previous versions of most browsers, one setting was provided to switch off javascript. But not anymore. New browser no more provide this option since more and more websites are becoming javascript heavy and they simply do not work if javascript is disabled.
So we need a third party tool which can disable javascript in the browser.

Browser plugins to the rescue

Most browsers have addons or plugins which we can install in the browser. Various plugins are available to disable javascript in browsers. We can search the browser addon market and find many.

Our favorite plugin for this purpose

No Script

The NoScript Firefox extension provides extra protection for Firefox browsers. It is free and open source add-on which allows JavaScript, Java, Flash and other plugins to be executed only by trusted web sites of your choice. NoScript also provides the most powerful anti-XSS and anti-Clickjacking protection ever available in a browser.
With noscript we can choose which site can execute javascript and which can’t.

So what we actually have to do?

Just install noscript in firefox and follow the tutorial.

Tutorial to copy content from a website with Copy Protector enabled

Okay this is a really small tutorial here.
When you have noscript installed in firefox, there will appear an icon like this in your firefox window.

By default noscript do not allow any site to execute any javascript, java or flash code. So most sites will just stop working the way they usually do.

So first thing we have to do is disable the noscript gloablly.

  • Click on the noscript icon and unselect “Forbid Scripts globally”.

It will show a warning messag saying

“Scripts are going to be allowed globally (for every site). This is a potentially dangerous action. Do you really want to proceed?”

Just ignore it and press ok.

  • Now open the site from which you want to copy content.
  • With that site’s page open, again click on the no-script icon and select “Mark <site-name> as Untrusted”

Doing this will auto-refresh the page and no-scripts will be run from that page. This means none of the copy blocking plugins will work.

So, that’s what we wanted to achieve. If you have any questions and queries, please feel free to ask in comments. We also have forums where you can ask any question and me and our team will try to answer as per our knowledge.

entry.title: How to Optimize Your Database From cPanel
entry.content:
To help your website or blog in performance, keeping your database(s) optimized is always a great step. No matter you are using InMotion Hosting, GoDaddy Hosting, Hostgator hosting or any other hosting cPanel account or hosting Account, this can be easily done using phpMyAdmin. Make it sure before optimizing your database all your data backup. You can ”Optimize Table” to reclaim unused space and defregment the data file for optimal performance.  If a lot of changes have been made to a table, optimizing the table can sometimes significantly improve performance.

Steps to Optimize Database tables from cPanel..

  • Log in to your website cPanel.


  • Click on phpMyAdmin under Databases section.


  • Now look at left, you will see your `Database` name on which you’re working on there, just click on it.


  • Now go down and click on `Check All` it will select all your database tables.
 
  • Click on drop down Menu next to `Check All/Uncheck All` and select `Optimize table`.

This is it, you have done, database of your website has been optimized, if you have any sub-domains or any Add on domains in your account then just do same things (step 3 to 5) to optimize their databases. Database optimization is recommended to do on a regular basis as a preventive measure, it doesn’t take much effort but it do affect a site’s or blog’s performance a lot.

  •  Website Fulfill almost every points mentioned on Program Policies & Terms of Service (TOS).
  • Website or Blog Getting  decent Traffic.
  • There is no too many pages on your Blog.
  • There is no Copyrighted data on your blog from any other blog use original content, write for your blog by yourself.
 Now you may understand Creating a website is not a big deal at all, the real challenge is to get traffic and that too from search engines so if your blog has very less traffic than wait few months and than apply for Adsense. Your website should be according to the Terms and Conditions of Google make it sure there is  no adult content, warez, gambling sites, Hacking and hate spreading contents & Copyrighted Data or post on your website. Be Regular on updating Post try to upload a new post in 3-4 days on your blog  if it’s not possible for you than fix a time interval for uploading posts and follow them sincerely, regularly updating Blogs attracts Google and If they find useful contents on your blog your account will be approved without any problem.

 Quality and Original  Content

Quality Content is the Best than anything on a blog,  as a famous writer said “It’s Good to publish a single quality Article once in a week than Publishing Scrap Daily”. This is very simple to understand If Post or Content on your Blog is Original (not copyrighted) and written in the best manner then your Application will be accepted very easily by the Adsense Team. You can take ideas from any blog or website but you can’t Copy and paste them on your blog otherwise You will never Get  an Approved Adsense Account.  

Simple and Easy Design

 Before submitting your site for Adsense make sure that the design you use in the site is a simple one with no much graphics works also it is nice if you have a easy navigation process in your site and try to avoid other ad networks while the reviewing process is going on, its not a compulsory one but a simple factor which may  help you to get the Adsense.

Also remember to avoid any kinds of adult, hate spreading and Hacking contents since Adsense won’t approve any sites that is having such contents.  

 Apply Once, wait for Reply

Now If you think that your Blog is ready for submitting to Adsense after reading the points given above then you go to Adsense  Sign up Page and then submit complete information about your Blog & yourself and make it sure you  fill only real personal information.

After sending application to Adsense you will get a reply e-mail from Adsense Team regarding they partially checked your website after that  follow the procedure given in the mail.  If You can’t received any mail from them then Don’t worry you will be surely respond, sometimes it takes time because they have millions of application from the bloggers all over the world. Generally they reply in maximum 4 days, sometime they reply in 2 days or even 1 day.

If your application got Disapproved by the Adsense Team, don’t start Crying :D Don’t worry they mention point why your request got  disapproved just fulfill the requirement (mentioned in point)  and apply again because they have lot of applications and they give preference to only Best. Some people when get disapproval mail they send another request instantly  from different email account without taking care of the point in the mail, you don’t do this foolish thing because your blog was not checked by any person their machine or Software check blogs and Website and don’t matter how many email accounts you use for submitting application they only approve your blog if their machine and Software declare it okay.

By fulfilling all these points and following steps you will get an approved Google Adsense Account easily in maximum 4-5 days. Note :

Use your real name instead of using any nick or fake name in application if You need to be 18 years old or above, and always remember Even after your blog got approved and you start running Google ads on your blog or website you can’t post anything on it, if you break the TOS, your Adsense account will be removed or possibly banned. entry.title: Most Common Reasons for Disapproval of Google Adsense Application
entry.content:
In blogging many people says that I applied for Ads to the Google, but my application got rejected or whenever I apply for Adsense Ads, Google disapproves my request. Even my requests got disapproved two times before I got approved, but people don’t know, what are the reasons responsible for the disapproval of their Adsense application, Google always mentions some reasons in reply email which are responsible for not accepting one’s Ads application. If you read those email(s) properly then you will understand some of the points why Google rejected it.

Most common reasons for disapproval of your Adsense Application..

1. Too Many Tags or Keywords

You  might know that Tags plays a very important role in improving your page’s visibility in the search engines. Search engines always search for the tags which show what is in your post. Actually these tags are the keywords or the word phrases that people types on different search engines for searching answer of their query. If you don’t know that then must settle this thing in your mind that, you should not give too many keywords in your post, because sometimes written articles are not so informative, but if it contains too many keywords search engines crawls, just because there are many keywords, but Google will not take the post as a healthy webpage, which makes a negative impression of your site to the search engine and Google never approve ads request from those blogs/sites.

Tags must be used in the post according to it’s quantity and quality. Using unusual, useless and irrelevant tags with an article reduces your credibility with the search engines and even people who come to see your website will not feel good, just imagine the moment you are searching for something and you open pages shown from search engine but you won’t find anything about the thing you are searching for, I’m sure you will never comeback to that particular site then why someone comes to your.

See using irrelevant, useless and inappropriate tags in your post may increase your visitors but Google will not accept your Adsense request, because as a good service provider Google always wants to provide best output to the every person using it.

2. Lack of Quality Content

You must read this very very carefully, whenever you start writing for you website or any website you must write informative and original content instead of copying someone’s idea before you apply for Google Adsense. As I said Google is the best search engine and as the best service provider Google always looks for content that visitors would love to read from beginning till the end. If your website contains very few articles you will find it really difficult to get approve Adsense account. Atleast in the beginning, prefer to write content that which attaract the attention of readers so that Google consider your application. In your post use titles  and heading that are catchy as well as popular, and never neglect to post genuine and innovative material.and one most important point in article writing is it is better to have text as well as quality pictures in your post and also include videos too, these things make the post more interactive. People love to stay on those pages instead of the webpages that contain only text in post, but it doesn’t mean you use use picture in each of your post, if pictures are not relevant don’t use them.

3. Presence of Copied Content

People think they can make Google fool but dear this is really a very tough thing to do, so if you are using any kind of copy paste either you stop this or stop dreaming of Adsense ads on your site because Google really hate copied and it’s not so tough for google to figure out copied content in a post or webpage, You may don’t know that but it’s true that by doing this you are harming your prestige in the cyber world. Google uses many algorithms and systems to track any kind copied content or any material easily, and most important by doing this you will disgrace your image in front of your readers.

It’s pretty easy to understand that, copy+paste is very easy for anyone one can copy content of a website and paste it on his own but as we know such kind of content isn’t consider as new and so that the particular blog or site will not get indexed by search engines and will not get ranking too. If Google or other search engines will not index your page then from where you will get visitors, from nowhere ! and as the result visits, views and clicks on your blog will be very low and you will get nothing. In short don’t do copy-paste.

4. Invalid Clicks and Comments

Many people generally thinks that if they click on their webpages their pageviews, traffic will increase and by doing this they will earn better but guys it’s called invalid clicks which is considered as a fraud or cheating by the internet companies. People who don’t have Adsense yet must remember, invalid clicks activity will make it much more difficult for your blog to get approved and even if you have approved Adsense account it doesn’t meant it will stay with you forever, invalid clicks and impression can also lead to cancellation of your approved adsense account.

5. Incomplete Websites

This is the most important factor people don’t think about, they won’t give their attention to this but Google does, various necessary pages like About page, Privacy page and Contact page is very essential for Adsense, these pages provides info. about the blogger and Blog (the content what your blog contains) it creates a bond between readers and the blogger. Before submitting your application for Google Adsense you must have complete webpages that can be considered by Google, and yes Incomplete webpages will not be accepted and your application will get rejected until you complete it and resubmit your form.

entry.title: Awesome SEO Tricks to Optimize Your Website in SERP
entry.content:
SEO (Search Engine Optimization) is the most critical factor which is responsible for optimizing of any blog or website and make it’s appearance on all the top Search Engine in searched Results which enhance the traffic on your a website. Critical factor which is important here is to get the keywords on which you want the visitors to reach your site through SERP (Search Engine Results Page). Well in case you are new in blogging field then you must need to  be aware of some very basic SEO tips and tricks to improve your website’s ranking in the Search engine results.

Awesome SEO tricks to Optimize Your Website in SERP

Keywords in Title Tag

If you know about this then read this point one time and if you are not familiar with this I will recommend you to read this at least thrice, Title Tag is one of the most important factor to take  your posts on higher level searched results based on Keywords you chosen. This tag gets visible in the clickable link on the SERPs. It is always recommended to to start your title with a long-tail keyword having less competition, you must use Adwords tool for this. Always try to use your Keyword within the range of 65 characters as search engine bots give preference to them, and always try to repetition of Keywords in your posts title otherwise your site could be penalized.

Use Keywords in Header Tags

Header tags are one of the most compelling on-page search engine optimization factors. Try to use the same keywords in all the heading tags by following this simple trick you can easily transfer focus of the page on a single keyword while superiority in search engines. You should better use your main keyword in the first section tag and try to keep the use of keywords in mandatory required way.

Use Keywords in Image Alt tag

I think this point is very much responsible for success of Harkuchh.com and many other blogs on web, Images are best way to express many words, and Search Engine Spiders don’t understand image so it have to translate any images they only read the alt tag with text description to understand the image. Therefore, it is essential to have a substantial description of any image you use in your post on your website. This will surely optimize the images in your content and rank higher in search image.

Use Power of Internal Linking

Never ever make mistake of avoiding internal linking as it’s one of the most significant factor and most of the bloggers specially Newbies often ignore Internal Linking which lead them to failure. The better approach is to reactivate and revitalize the old posts in archive, as compared to link them in your fresh posts. Never ignore the role of internal linking in the distribution of page rank.

Links from Directories

There are so many top Directories over internet which helps the submitted websites and links to get searched on search engines so Planting in directories, like Google’s Webmasters, Yahoo, DMOZ and some other article and content directories can be very helpful to achieve positive ranking and get more searched as well.

Meta Description

Well Google now gives quite less importance to meta tags but still there are two meta tags matter in SEO, Meta description tag are important for both human and search engine perspective. Description meta tag is what you use to illustrate your website. In fact, this description is what visitors see when your site appears in the search results.

Use Keywords Meta Tag

Put your relevant keywords in Keywords tags but take care of avoiding replicas and Keyword stuffing in post, tags or anywhere else. The keywords that you mention in the keyword tag is used to the context of your page are relevant, and the keywords used in meta keywords must be written somewhere in your post or article, if you will not do this by this way your website will be penalized for irrelevant content and it will give you that pain which is not easy to suffer from.

entry.title: How to Make a Link Nofollow in WordPress
entry.content:
Before proceeding, I think knowing the difference between a no-follow and a do-follow link is very vital, Nofollow and dofollow are two very oftenly used words in SEO. Blogging became very popular in last half decade, but many Bloggers of our generation making a big mistake in blogging, and it is spreading of dofollow links to other website-blogs unnecessarily. See, while writing post on your blog when you give a link of any other blog somewhere in your post it becomes a dofollow link and by this way you are giving a free do follow link to that blog, which is really not needed. A normal Dofollow link allows all search engines to follow them and reach the linked website. It give link juice and a back link. If a webmaster is linking back to you with this link both Search Engine and people will be able to follow. Enable The best way to give someone dofollow love making keyword in the anchor text. This means that when you use a link to a website or page, the targeted keywords as anchor text. A modified Nofollow links does not allow any search engine robot to surf the link, now here point to pay attention is that, if you’ll give a nofollow attribute tag to a links on your web page or website it links you from other page but because of nofollow attribute, it does not pass link juice. Any Reader can only follow the links but search engines don’t. It’s a strong Google’s recommendation that when we link our article with any other website we must have to be very sure that it’s a good website. Sometimes we need to link some p0rn , hacking kind of sites which are generally not consider as a legit or good site, there you will have to add nofollow link attribute. It becomes even more necessary if you are using affiliate marketing, and keep adding affiliate links on your blog. Being truthful, adding a nofollow tag to any link is damn easy, in order to make any link nofollow, all you need to do is `add nofollow attributes in HTML formal` for example <a href=”http://royalyouth.com” rel=”nofollow” > Royalyouth</a> But I’m pretty sure many of us wants to get things done more easier, I know some might not like the idea of using HTML to add Nofollow link attribute.

WordPress plugin to add no-follow Tag attribute

As the most awesome feature of WordPress is that, you can have plugin for doing almost any thing. For WordPress users there are some plugins which will let then make all the outgoing links nofollow, but we don’t have to make all external links nofollow because there are also several benefits of dofollow external link in SEO.
